section.title: openedx.features.course_duration_limits.access module
section.paragraph: Contains code related to computing content gating course duration limits and course access based on these limits.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: AccessError
Access denied because the user’s audit timespan has expired
Check if the course expired for the user.
An XBlock wrapper that prepends a message to the beginning of a vertical if a user’s course is about to expire.
Like generate_course_expired_fragment, but using a CourseKey instead of a CourseOverview and using request-level caching.
Either returns WebFragment to inject XBlock content into, or None if we shouldn’t show a course expired message for this user.
Generate the message for the user course expiration date if it exists.
Create a dictionary of information about the access expiration for this user & course.
Used by serializers to pass onto frontends and by the LMS locally to generate HTML for template rendering.
Returns a dictionary of data, or None if no expiration is applicable.
Return a timedelta measuring the duration of the course for a particular user.

list_item.paragraph: Course access duration is bounded by the min and max duration.
If course fields are missing, default course access duration to MIN_DURATION.

desc_content.paragraph: Return expiration date for given user course pair. Return None if the course does not expire.

list_item.paragraph: Course access duration is bounded by the min and max duration.
If course fields are missing, default course access duration to MIN_DURATION.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: AppConfig
Bases: StackedConfigurationModel
Configuration to manage the Course Duration Limit facility.
desc_content.comment: toggle_description: When enabled, users will have a limited time to complete and audit the course. The exact duration is given by the "weeks_to_complete" course detail. When enabled, it is necessary to also define the "enabled_as_of" flag: only enrollments created after this date will be affected.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.
A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.
Return whether this Course Duration Limit configuration context is enabled as of a date and time.

field_body.paragraph: target_datetime (datetime.datetime) – The datetime that enabled_as_of must be equal to or before

desc_content.paragraph: Return whether Course Duration Limits are enabled for this course as of a particular date.

Course Duration Limits are enabled for a course on a date if they are enabled either specifically, or via a containing context, such as the org, site, or globally, and if the configuration is specified to be enabled_as_of before target_datetime.
Only one of enrollment and (user, course_key) may be specified at a time.

list_item.paragraph: course_key – The CourseKey of the course being queried.
target_datetime – The datetime to checked enablement as of. Defaults to the current date and time.

desc_content.paragraph: Return whether Course Duration Limits are enabled for this enrollment.

Course Duration Limits are enabled for an enrollment if they are enabled for the course being enrolled in (either specifically, or via a containing context, such as the org, site, or globally), and if the configuration is specified to be enabled_as_of before the enrollment was created.

list_item.paragraph: course_key – The CourseKey of the course being queried.
course – The CourseOverview object being queried.
